formal_accuser.name: procureur for Chapter of St Dié

confession.seduction_context: Evening returning from the craigne, Colas approached her saying her husband treated her badly and asking if she wanted to kill him. She refused at first, but after being driven out of house by husband, accepted powder to make him lame.
sabbat_activities: carried in the air by master

timeline.subject: Jehennon femme Jean Perrin
timeline.details: Taken at request of procureur for Chapter of St Dié; 24 witnesses deposed

timeline.subject: Jehennon femme Holbin Jean Holbin
timeline.details: Fifth witness returned to add testimony about seeing 2 men in black 6 years earlier

timeline.subject: Jehennon femme Jean Perrin
timeline.details: Arrested after witness returned with additional testimony

timeline.subject: Jehennon femme Jean Perrin
timeline.details: First interrogation; denied all charges, explained she was too poor to seek legal redress for being called witch

timeline.subject: Jehennon femme Jean Perrin
timeline.details: Confronted with witnesses; no reproaches, denied everything except minor disputes

timeline.subject: Jehennon femme Jean Perrin
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture; given thumbscrews, racked, tortillons; confessed to seduction by Persin/Colas, attending sabbat, making hail, various maleficia

timeline.subject: Jehennon femme Jean Perrin
timeline.details: Repeated confessions and accusations (note: date appears out of sequence in document)

timeline.subject: Jehennon femme Jean Perrin
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence after interrogation under threat of torture

timeline.subject: Jehennon femme Jean Perrin
timeline.details: Final interrogation; insisted all she said was true but added nothing else

timeline.subject: Jehennon femme Jean Perrin
timeline.details: Note that she has been executed

torture.requesting_official: procureur for Chapter of St Dié

accomplices_named.name: Jehennon Colin femme Jean Pairson
accomplices_named.context: Saw at sabbat; blamed for death of cow of Nicolas Alexis and other losses; had fled

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehennon femme Holbin Jean Holbin
notable_quotes.french: et qui ne vouldroit pas craindre, voyant telles choses, et qu'on ne scait comme les fortunes arrivent
notable_quotes.english: and who would not be afraid, seeing such things, and one does not know how misfortunes arrive
notable_quotes.context: After seeing 2 men in black at night

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Grillat (maire)
notable_quotes.french: Qu'il en failloit mourir des sorcieres icy, qui luy faisoient ainsy mourir ses chevaux, et qu'on voioit bien que faisoient elles
notable_quotes.english: That the witches here must die, who made his horses die thus, and one could see well what they did
notable_quotes.context: Seeing Jehennon passing after losing 4 horses

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehennon femme Jean Perrin (confession)
notable_quotes.french: vouloit tousjours faire que l'on eut vendu le bled a l'escuelle
notable_quotes.english: always wanted them to have sold grain by the bowlful
notable_quotes.context: Persin's goal in damaging crops - to create scarcity and high prices

relationships.evidence_text: Jehennon femme Jean Perrin de Girovillers; came to Geriviller on marriage to Jean Perrin 18 years earlier
Catherine femme Francois Grillat de Mathchey
immediate neighbours with Jehennon Micquel, wife of Holbin Jean Holbin
Françoise veuve Nicolas Micquel; husband fell ill and died
Hellony femme Pierron Demenge Gerard, doyen de Messieurs
next neighbour; had minor disputes about animals and land
she and 2 daughters went out to continue reaping (Mengeatte's testimony); same story as above (Bietrix's testimony)
she and husband were working for father (of Jean Hacquart)
saw Nicolle Grillat, femme Colas Lolbiat at sabbat
saw Jehennon Colin, femme Jean Pairson at sabbat

economic_context.details: Jehennon stated they were poor and lacked means to seek legal redress when called witch. Husband Jean Perrin had sold her property. There were disputes about animals and land with neighbors Colas Lolbiat and Jehennon Micquel. Husband caught stealing tithe sheaves, grapes, and hay. Payment disputes over son's threshing work for Nicolas Grillet. Husband served as sergent and fined horses of Claudon de Grand Pray 'unjustly.' Economic losses valued at 200 francs mentioned by Demenge Curien for cattle losses.

harms_catalog.harm_description: found dead in stream with neck twisted, not enough water to cause death
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Jehennon and husband said they were foolish to look for cow, it would be in stream

limp (illness causing limp, completed by Jehennon after wife initiated it); another illness lasting 6 weeks which she treated

material_culture.context: Jehennon gave perry to two women who died - mother of Catherine Grillat and wife of Colas Lolbiat
Catherine and husband killed their cat, leading to arguments with Jehennon
Husband of Françoise wrapped injured foal in sheet to cure it
Jean Hacquart gave legs of mutton to Jehennon before she made him soup
Jehennon made soup for Jean Hacquart which cured his illness
Husband caught stealing tithe sheaves by Nicolas Grillat
Husband caught stealing grapes by Nicolas Grillat
Husband stole hay from Demenge Curien
Husband of Demenge Curien struck cow with stick after it butted another cow
Fine that Thierry Jean Thierry was supposed to collect from Jehennon's husband

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial; residence of accused and most witnesses
Location of Chapter court and where she was taken for trial
Current residence of Catherine femme Francois Grillat
Where Catherine lived with parents 12 years earlier
Where cow of Nicolas Alexis was found dead with twisted neck
Place where people gathered to keep warm; Demenge Curien excluded Jehennon from his craigne; Jehennon returning from craigne when she saw white figure
White figure (Persin/Colas) seen going towards church
Pierron Demenge Gerard lost cow after Jehennon went into stable by back door
Horse ran through fields until killed; village fields damaged on St John's Eve
Wife of Demenge Curien became ill among the vines

historical_context.military_details: Reference to 'year of Bouillon's army' when she and husband were working for father of Jean Hacquart
weather_events: terrible wind that gave fever to reapers
storm/hail on St John's Eve damaging village fields
cloud brought back by Persin when marlier stopped ringing bells
economic_hardship_indicators: lacked means to seek legal redress
husband caught stealing tithe sheaves, grapes, hay
disputes over payment for son's threshing work
husband drove her out of house at night
sometimes lodged by fearful neighbors when driven out
confession: Persin wanted grain sold by bowlful (scarcity, high prices)

officials_named.name: procureur for Chapter of St Dié

Husband stole hay from Demenge Curien

legal_context.redress_outcome: Husband told her they were poor and lacked means to seek redress by justice when called witch

hearsay_chains.content: herdsman suggested lost cow might be in neighbouring village

third_parties.name: Jean Perrin (husband)
third_parties.context: Frequently mentioned as co-suspect; told he confessed during torture (likely false); caught stealing; drove her out of house; served as sergent; she made him lame according to confession

third_parties.name: herdsman
third_parties.context: Suggested lost cow might be in neighbouring village

third_parties.name: medecin
third_parties.context: Said horse had been bewitched by a woman

third_parties.name: Colas Collenat
third_parties.context: Called both Jehennon and husband witch

third_parties.name: wife of Colas Collenat
third_parties.context: Called both Jehennon and husband witch

third_parties.name: father of Catherine femme Colas Poirel
third_parties.context: Jehennon and husband worked for him; lost best horse

third_parties.name: wife of Colas Gobellat
third_parties.context: Called Jehennon witch without her seeking reparation

third_parties.name: father of Jean Hacquart
third_parties.context: Jehennon and husband worked for him in year of Bouillon's army; advised son to treat her well so she would heal him

third_parties.name: wife of Jean Hacquart
third_parties.context: Asked Jehennon to make soup for husband

third_parties.name: son of Jehennon femme Jean Perrin
third_parties.context: Did threshing for Nicolas Grillat; Jehennon discontented over payment; no longer living

third_parties.name: son-in-law of Françoise veuve Nicolas Micquel
third_parties.context: Beaten a foal belonging to Nicolas Micquel; beaten in retaliation

third_parties.name: Demenge Marchal
third_parties.context: Jehennon denied being excluded from his craigne (said he didn't hold one that winter); may be same as Demenge Curien

third_parties.name: marlier
third_parties.context: Stopped ringing bells on St John's Eve, allowing Persin to bring cloud back and damage village fields

third_parties.name: Penthecoste
third_parties.context: Jehennon confessed to making her ill then curing her

third_parties.name: mother of Catherine femme Francois Grillat
third_parties.context: Died 4 months after drinking perry given by Jehennon; blamed Jehennon before death

third_parties.name: wife of Colas Lolbiat
third_parties.context: Died 8 years earlier after drinking perry given by Jehennon; according to confession, she (as Nicolle Grillat) was accomplice at sabbat and gave husband beginning of illness causing limp

third_parties.name: 2 daughters of Mengeatte
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: daughters of witness 23; one is witness 24
third_parties.context: Had fever for month after terrible wind while reaping

third_parties.name: 2 men in black
third_parties.context: Jehennon femme Holbin Jean Holbin saw them passing through village at night 6 years earlier; Jehennon denied seeing them

extraction_metadata.notes: Clear, well-documented trial with extensive witness testimony. Uncertainty regarding whether Demenge Curien and Demenge Marchal are the same person (accused denied being excluded from 'Demenge Marchal's' craigne but witnesses reference Demenge Curien). Date sequence issue: October 9 entry appears after October 19 in document, may be transcription error. Document uses 'morveux' for horse disease (likely glanders). Multiple officials named 'Nicolas Grillat' at different ages (70 as lieutenant de maire, 44 as maire de la seigneurie) - may be different people or title change. Healing practice: while she made soup that cured Jean Hacquart, marked as 'other' healing type since context suggests it was maleficent healing (giving and removing illness) rather than benevolent healing practice.
